01287     //    CIFW are warnings which may be issued on reading the CIF file.
01288     // Each of them means actually a CIF syntax error.
01289 
01290     enum CIF_WARNING  {
01291       CIFW_UnrecognizedItems = 0x00000020,
01292       CIFW_MissingField      = 0x00000040,
01293       CIFW_EmptyLoop         = 0x00000080,
01294       CIFW_UnexpectedEOF     = 0x00000100,
01295       CIFW_LoopFieldMissing  = 0x00000200,
01296       CIFW_NotAStructure     = 0x00000400,
01297       CIFW_NotALoop          = 0x00000800,
01298       CIFW_DuplicateTag      = 0x00001000
01299     };
01300 
01301     //    CIFRC are return codes from procedures of extracting data from
01302     // the read CIF file. Negative returns reflect unsuccessful and
01303     // not accomplished operation.
01304     enum CIF_RC  {
01305       CIFRC_Loop           =  2,
01306       CIFRC_Structure      =  1,
01307       CIFRC_Ok             =  0,
01308       CIFRC_StructureNoTag = -1,
01309       CIFRC_LoopNoTag      = -2,
01310       CIFRC_NoCategory     = -3,
01311       CIFRC_WrongFormat    = -4,
01312       CIFRC_NoTag          = -5,
01313       CIFRC_NotAStructure  = -6,
01314       CIFRC_NotALoop       = -7,
01315       CIFRC_WrongIndex     = -8,
01316       CIFRC_NoField        = -9,
01317       CIFRC_Created        = -12,
01318       CIFRC_CantOpenFile   = -13,
01319       CIFRC_NoDataLine     = -14,
01320       CIFRC_NoData         = -15
01321     };
01322 
01323     //
01324     //  Functional flags:
01325     //  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
01326     //
01327     //  CIFFL_PrintWarnings      when reading CIF file, all warning
01328     //                           messages will be printed. If the flag
01329     //                           is off, the warnings will be bit-encoded
01330     //                           in the return code
01331     //  CIFFL_StopOnWarnings     reading CIF file will stop at first
01332     //                           warning issued
01333     //  CIFFL_SuggestCategories  allows reading CIF file with loops having
01334     //                           no categories. Hidden category names
01335     //                           will be automatically generated for
01336     //                           internal consistency of the system.
01337     //                           These names will not appear in output.
01338     //                           As these names are hidden, they cannot
01339     //                           be used to access data. It is therefore
01340     //                           assumed that all tags in all loops without
01341     //                           categories are unique. Simply specify ""
01342     //                           for category when accessing such data
01343     //                           (it cannot be accessed through mmcif::Loop,
01344     //                           but only through mmcif::Data functions
01345     //                           taking both Category and Tag; note that
01346     //                           CIFFL_SuggestCategories flag must be on
01347     //                           while accessing such data).
01348     //  CIFFL_SuggestTags        allows for identical tags in a category
01349     //                           (including a hidden category). Hidden
01350     //                           suffixes to tag names will be generated
01351     //                           for internal consistency. At present,
01352     //                           only data for first non-unique tag may be
01353     //                           accessed.
01354     //
01355     enum CIF_FLAG  {
01356       CIFFL_PrintWarnings     = 0x00000001,
01357       CIFFL_StopOnWarnings    = 0x00000002,
01358       CIFFL_SuggestCategories = 0x00000004,
01359       CIFFL_SuggestTags       = 0x00000008
01360     };
01361

01363     DefineStreamFunctions(Data);
01364

01765 
01768         inline int   GetNumberOfCategories ()  { return nCategories; }
01769 
01782         PCategory GetCategory ( int categoryNo ); // 0..nCategories-1
01783

01827         void GetDataName ( pstr & dname, bool Remove=false );
01828 
01830         inline pstr GetDataName()  { return name; }
01831 
01832         //   CheckData(..) returns positive value if the field is in the
01833         // file:
01834         //   CIFRC_Structure  category CName is a structure
01835         //   CIFRC_Loop       category CName is a loop
01836         // Negative returns mean:
01837         //   CIFRC_StructureNoTag  category CName is present,
01838         //                        it is a structure, but it does not
01839         //                        have tag TName
01840         //   CIFRC_LoopNoTag       category CName is present,
01841         //                        it is a loop, but it does not have
01842         //                        tag TName
01843         //   CIFRC_NoCategory      category CName is not present.
01844         // If TName is set to NULL then only the CName is checked and
01845         // possible returns are CIFRC_Structure, CIFRC_Loop and
01846         // CIFRC_NoCategory.
01847         int  CheckData       ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName );
01848 
01849         int  DeleteCategory  ( cpstr CName );
01850         int  DeleteStructure ( cpstr CName );
01851         int  DeleteLoop      ( cpstr CName );
01852 
01853         //   Optimize() optimizes the CIF data in memory allocation. It is
01854         // a good idea to call it once after extraction of data (GetXXXXXX
01855         // functions) with Remove flag set on has been completed.
01856         void Optimize();
01857 
01858         //   GetString(..), GetReal(..) and GetInteger(..) return 0 if the
01859         // requested field was found and successfully converted. Negative
01860         // returns mean:
01861         //    CIFRC_WrongFormat   the field was found but failed to convert
01862         //                        due to improper numeric format
01863         //    CIFRC_NoTag         category CName was found, but it does not
01864         //                        have tag TName
01865         //    CIFRC_NoCategory    category CName was not found
01866         //    CIFRC_NotAStructure category CName was found, but it is
01867         //                        a loop rather than a structure.
01868         //   GetString(..) will try to dispose Dest unless it is assigned
01869         // NULL value before the call. The string will be then dynamically
01870         // allocated and copied.
01871         //   If Remove is set to true, the field will be removed after
01872         // extraction.
01873         int  GetString   ( pstr & Dest, cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
01874                                         bool Remove=false );
01875         pstr GetString   ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName, int & RC );
01876         int  DeleteField ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName );
01877         int  GetReal     ( realtype & R, cpstr CName,
01878                            cpstr TName, bool Remove=false );
01879         int  GetInteger  ( int & I, cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
01880                                     bool Remove=false );
01881 
01882         //   GetLoopLength(..) returns CIFRC_NotALoop if the category CName
01883         // is not a loop, CIFRC_NoCategory if the category CName is not
01884         // found. Non-negative returns give the length of the loop (may be
01885         // 0 if the loop is empty).
01886         int  GetLoopLength ( cpstr CName );
01887 
01888         //   GetLoopString(..), GetLoopReal(..) and GetLoopInteger(..) act
01889         // like GetString(..), GetReal(..) and GetInteger(..) above for
01890         // nrow-th element of the 'loop_' (indexed like 0..N-1 where N
01891         // is obtained through GetLoopLength(..)). They will return
01892         // CIFRC_WrongIndex if nrow is out of range.
01893         //   If Remove is set to true, the field will be removed after
01894         // extraction.
01895         int  GetLoopString   ( pstr & Dest, cpstr CName,
01896                                             cpstr TName, int nrow,
01897                                             bool Remove=false );
01898         pstr GetLoopString   ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
01899                                int nrow, int & RC );
01900         int  DeleteLoopField ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
01901                                int nrow );
01902         int  GetLoopReal     ( realtype & R, cpstr CName,
01903                                              cpstr TName, int nrow,
01904                                              bool Remove=false );
01905         int  GetLoopInteger  ( int & I, cpstr CName,
01906                                         cpstr TName, int nrow,
01907                                         bool Remove=false );
01908 
01909         //   GetLoopSVector(..), GetLoopRVector(..) and GetLoopIVector(..)
01910         // read CIF 'loop_' data into allocated vectors of strings, reals
01911         // and integers, correspondingly. The vectors may be deallocated
01912         // prior to call and assigned NULL, in which case they will be
01913         // allocated with offsets of i1, which is also the lower index of
01914         // the 'loop_' data transferred into it. The upper vector index is
01915         // given by i2 or by the loop's length whichever is less. If
01916         // vectors are not assigned NULL prior the call, it is assumed
01917         // that they are properly (i1-offset, i2-i1+1 length) allocated.
01918         //   The return codes are same as those of GetLoopString(..),
01919         // GetLoopReal(..) and GetLoopInteger(..).
01920         int  GetLoopSVector ( psvector & S, cpstr CName,
01921                               cpstr TName, int i1=0, int i2=MaxInt4,
01922                               bool Remove=false );
01923         int  GetLoopRVector ( rvector  & R, cpstr CName,
01924                               cpstr TName, int i1=0, int i2=MaxInt4,
01925                               bool Remove=false );
01926         int  GetLoopIVector ( ivector  & I, cpstr CName,
01927                               cpstr TName, int i1=0, int i2=MaxInt4,
01928                               bool Remove=false );
01929 
01930 
01931         // -------- Storing data
01932 
01933         //   Unless the data are to be added to the existing CIF structure,
01934         // FreeMemory() should be called once before creating a new
01935         // CIF data set.
01936         void FreeMemory ( int key );
01937 
01938         void PutDataName ( cpstr dname ); // stores name for 'data_'
01939                                           // record
01940 
01941         //   PutString(..), PutReal(..) and PutInteger(..) will put the
01942         // values given into the specified category (CName) under the
01943         // specified tag (TName). The category, tag and field are created
01944         // automatically; the field will be replaced silently if identical
01945         // CName.TName is specified in two calls. Calls of these functions
01946         // may follow in random order; however CIF file will have all tags
01947         // grouped by categories and catgories will follow in the order
01948         // of first appearance in PutString(..), PutReal(..) or
01949         // PutInteger(..).
01950         //   Return code - one of CIFRC_Ok or CIFRC_NotAStruct
01951         int  PutNoData   ( int NoDataType, cpstr CName,
01952                            cpstr TName );
01953         int  PutString   ( cpstr S, cpstr CName,
01954                            cpstr TName, bool Concatenate=false );
01955         int  PutDate     ( cpstr CName, cpstr TName );
01956         int  PutReal     ( realtype R, cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
01957                                        int prec=8 );
01958         int  PutInteger  ( int I, cpstr CName, cpstr TName );
01959 
01960         //   If loop category CName is not present in the CIF data
01961         // structure, AddLoop(..) creates an empty one and returns
01962         // its pointer in Loop. If loop category CName is already in
01963         // the CIF data structure, its pointer is returned, and any
01964         // data which might be contained in it, remains untouched.
01965         //   To stuff the loop with data, first the data tags have to
01966         // be specified by calling  Loop->AddLoopTag(..). After all
01967         // tags are given, the data comes as a stream of calls
01968         // Loop->AddString(..), Loop->AddReal(..) and
01969         // Loop->AddInteger(..) which should provide data for every
01970         // tag in sequence in strictly the same order as the tags
01971         // were given. This essentially reflects reading a CIF loop
01972         // from a file.
01973         //   Alternatively, the loop data may be stored with PutLoopXXX()
01974         // functions given below, although this way may be less
01975         // efficient (but more flexible).
01976         //   AddLoop(..) may return
01977         //     CIFRC_Ok       category was present
01978         //     CIFRC_Created  category was not present but it has
01979         //                    been created; the category is empty
01980         //     CIFRC_NotALoop category was present as a structure, but
01981         //                    has been replaced for a loop;
01982         //                    the category is empty.
01983         int  AddLoop      ( cpstr CName, PLoop   & cifLoop   );
01984         int  AddStructure ( cpstr CName, PStruct & cifStruct );
01985 
01986         //   PutLoopString(..), PutLoopReal(..) and PutLoopInteger(..) act
01987         // like PutString(..), PutReal(..) and PutInteger(..) above for
01988         // nrow-th element of the 'loop_' CName (indexed begining from 0).
01989         // In consequitive calls, given values of nrow does not have to be
01990         // ordered; the most efficient way is to start with HIGHEST value
01991         // for nrow in the loop and move down to 0. The least efficient way
01992         // is to start with nrow=0 and move up.
01993         //   These functions allow to form loops in arbitrary way.
01994         //   The functions may return CIFRC_Ok or CIFRC_NotALoop.
01995         int  PutLoopNoData  ( int NoDataType, cpstr CName,
01996                                               cpstr TName, int nrow );
01997         int  PutLoopString  ( cpstr S,   cpstr CName,
01998                                               cpstr TName, int nrow );
01999         int  PutLoopReal    ( realtype R, cpstr CName,
02000                                           cpstr TName, int nrow,
02001                                           int  prec=8 );
02002         int  PutLoopInteger ( int I, cpstr CName, cpstr TName,
02003                                      int nrow );
02004 
02005         //   PutLoopSVector(..), PutLoopRVector(..) and PutLoopIVector(..)
02006         // put vectors of values into specified loop fields. Parameters i1
02007         // and i2 give the range of indices of values which are to be
02008         // transfered. To transfer an entire vector allocated as [0..N-1]
02009         // i1 shoudl be set to 0 and i2 - to N-1. Note that the loop is
02010         // always indexed as starting form 0 on, therefore negative i1 and
02011         // i2 are not allowed, and specifying i1>0 will leave first i1
02012         // elements of the CIF loop for the corresponding tag undefined
02013         // (will be output like '?').
02014         //   These functions allow to form loops in arbitrary way.
02015         int  PutLoopSVector ( psvector S, cpstr CName,
02016                               cpstr TName, int i1, int i2 );
02017         int  PutLoopRVector ( rvector  R, cpstr CName,
02018                               cpstr TName, int i1, int i2,
02019                               int prec=8 );
02020         int  PutLoopIVector ( ivector  I, cpstr CName,
02021                               cpstr TName, int i1, int i2 );
02022 
02023         int  RenameCategory ( cpstr CName, cpstr newCName );
